meanings.definition: To place at the top of a mast.
meanings.sent1: The sailor mastheaded the flag for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The flag was mastheaded proudly on the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull mastheaded a fish on the mast.
meanings.sent4: The sun mastheaded the sky with vibrant colors at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The storm mastheaded the sea, causing the waves to crash violently.

meanings.definition: To serve as the masthead of a publication.
meanings.sent1: The editor mastheaded the latest issue of the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper mastheaded by the editor was well-received.
meanings.sent3: The cat mastheaded the magazine, thinking it was a perch.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse mastheaded the coast, guiding ships to safety.
meanings.sent5: The logo mastheaded the website, giving it a professional look.
